intro: Acalypha aspericocca, commonly known as the rough-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Acalypha aspericocca is also known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
